lead_paragraph: The Congressional Budget Office reported that deficits, in decline for six years, will begin expanding again sooner than expected, posing tricky questions for presidential candidates of both parties.

headline.print_headline: Falling Deficit to Reverse Course in ’16 as U.S. Ages
headline.main: Falling Deficit to Reverse Course in 2016 as U.S. Ages

snippet: The Congressional Budget Office reported that deficits, in decline for six years, will begin expanding again sooner than expected, posing tricky questions for presidential candidates of both parties.
abstract: Congressional Budget Office reports federal deficit for fiscal year is projected to be $544 billion, ending six-year trend of declining deficits; trend poses potential problem for presidential hopefuls who are proposing trillions of dollars in new tax cuts or spending.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget
